p: More alternative surveillance methods include, for instance, prediction markets [ 16] that combine expert predictions using a stock market-like system, and the method of analogues (k nearest neighbors) [ 17] that makes predictions of future influenza activity levels using similar patterns from the past without assuming a strict model. However, it is disconcerting that none of the above categories of forecasting methods evaluated in the CDC challenge generated satisfying results for all four aspects of influenza epidemics (ie, start week, peak week, peak percentage, and duration) [ 18].
